document.docAuthor: Angulo, Arturo, López, Myrna I., Bussing, William A. & Murase, Atsunobu
document.masterDocTitle: Records of chimaeroid fishes (Holocephali: Chimaeriformes) from the Pacific coast of Costa Rica, with the description of a new species of Chimera (Chimaeridae) from the eastern Pacific Ocean

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Records of chimaeroid fishes (Holocephali: Chimaeriformes) from the Pacific coast of Costa Rica, with the description of a new species of Chimera (Chimaeridae) from the eastern Pacific Ocean

paragraph.materialsCitation:
4 specimens . UCR 2611–08, n=2, females, 435–581 mm TL, 223–343 mm BDL ; in front of Playa Coyote ,
Península de Nicoya
, Guanacaste , Costa Rica ( 9°40'50.02" N , 85°28'4.81" W ),
650–700 m
,
7 April 2000
, collected by M. Vitola.

UCR 2901–01, n=2, females, 543–639 mm TL, 334–349 mm BDL ; 44.95 Km , 253.73 ° T from Cabo Blanco , Puntarenas , Costa Rica ( 9º26'16.44" N , 85º29'56.04" W ),
560–620 m
,
24 November 2010
, collected by J.M. Carvajal.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body slender; snout short and bluntly rounded; head relatively short (HDL 24.2–24.5% BDL); eyes relatively large (EYL 30.9–34.2% HDL); oral and preopercular lateral line canals sharing a short common branch from the infraorbital canal; pectoral fins relatively large (P1A 36.5–40.8% BDL), extending posterior to the insertion of pelvic fins; lateral line canal of the trunk without sinusoidal undulations; anterior and posterior regions of second dorsal fin considerably taller than middle region; anal fin absent; tail region elongate and slender (PCA 58.3–59.9% BDL); caudal-fin axis horizontal with the fin nearly symmetrical, epaxial and hypaxial lobes equal sized; uniform brown coloration across entire body, with no white markings; bluish fins. Additional morphometric measurements, expressed as percentage of body length (% BDL) or head length (% HDL), and comparative data are presented in Table 5 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 5. Measurements and body proportions of
Hydrolagus macrophthalmus
from Costa Rica, type and comparative material (data from
González-Acosta et al. 2010
). Measurements not attainable (i.e. structure broken) or unavailable are represented with an en-dash (–).
